title: Nation, state, and issues in multination states

content.question: Many of the countries covered in the AP Comparative Government and Politics course are multination states. (a) Define the concept of a state. (b) Explain how a nation is different from a state. (c) Describe one challenge governments face in securing stability in multination states.(d) Discuss two policies that governments have taken to address the challenge you described in part (c).
